title: When I try to download a file it will not start
content:
About a week ago, Firefox suddenly stopped opening any download links I click on. When I click a link, the little dots in the Tab description slide back and forth and then just stop and nothing further happens.

I ran Firefox in Safe Mode and everything worked fine so I assumed it was an Add-On (I don't run any extensions). I restarted Firefox and disabled all extensions and then tried again...same problem, no downloads will start. I checked Hardware Acceleration and it's turned off and my Theme is set for basic.

As a further step, I uninstalled Firefox 32-bit and installed 64-bit. Unfortunately, the problem continues.

At this point I'm uncertain as to what else I can troubleshoot.

Any help would be appreciated! Thanks! :)

Please could someone help? Thank you.

title: Zoom level should be available, but is not
content:
I am viewing a PDF file within the browser, Firefox 85, on Windows 10. I am following this webpage to make 120% zoom available: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1201469

However, when I look at the zoom levels shown by toolkit.zoomManager.zoomValues, I already see the zoom level I want: 120% (showing as 1.2 in the list).

Unfortunately, 120% doesn't show in the list of zoom levels in my Zoom pulldown menu. The list jumps from 100% to 125%.

If I use "+" or "-" (either on the keyboard or the icons at the top of the page), the zoom jumps from 110% to 130%.

I am confused by two things.

1. The +/- zoom levels don't match the zoom levels in the pulldown menu..

2. Neither match the zoom levels shown by toolkit.zoomManager.zoomValues

How do I definitively control my zoom levels?

title: cancel search suggestions and completions by keystroke
content:
I like search suggestions. They're frequently helpful.

However, sometimes I just know where I'm going and I can type what I want faster than find it in search, and the search suggestions and completions just get in the way, obscuring the window underneath that I'm trying to read.

I don't want to turn them off permanently, but is there a way to cancel (or toggle) the search suggestions and completions by keystroke? If I hit ESC, it cancels the current suggestions until I hit one more key. I want to cancel them until I hit return or toggle them back on. Or possibly delay any new suggestions until I've stopped typing at least.

title: Youtube does not load via IPv6
content: Hello, I'm having some problems.... when I try to access youtube on firefox it just doesn't load. It stays on the same page I've been before. I recently out of deseperation tried aout using an vpn ...and voila youtube did load like nothing ever happened. Then I turned off the vpn and it didn't load again. So I turned off my IPv6 on firefox and tried loading again. This helped and youtube was loading again. Now I would like to know how to fix the problem with the IPv6, is there a chance this could be caused by a virus the scanners couldn't detect? All my other devices are working fine, it's just my laptop. On the edge browser I get the notification: Die Verbindung wurde offenbar von accounts.youtube.com getrennt. (german sorry: it means the connection has been disconnected by accounts.youtube.com) I hope you can help me :) Greetings Alex

content:
Im working for my government posting applies to this certain website: https://voucher.gov.gr/ui/project/37/personal

When an apply is completed i printed on pdf to save locally.

This was fine till Firefox update 85.00 ( i jumped from 83.00 to 85.00, i don't know why. but i can reproduce it even on 84.00.  ) When i tried to save as pdf, the character encoding of upper part of page (i think its header) you should defently see the exact same page to found out why ( https://voucher.gov.gr/ui/project/37/personal ) is appear with squares and the characters is losted, and unavailable. ( you can see here: https://imgur.com/a/W3g0Tz6 )

Also After the updated version for PRINT DIALOG (the new one) the new dialog, is not showed up, (see image) 

if you are updating from old version with old profile.

I had to delete the old profile to appear the new dialog, and there is no setting to get the new one, from old one.  On Firefox prior to 84.00: ( on 83.00 for example) this issue is not there ( and the page has not change at all), the save to pdf was working perfectly, and the characters as shown on the image, is perfectly grabbed and saved. I could not find any other website to replicate this issue so please, invest it here..

https://voucher.gov.gr/ui/project/37/personal

thank you.

title: How can I stop Firefox toolbar popping up when mouse is at top of screen in full-screen mode (without kiosk mode, please)?
content:
The archive post "How can I stop Firefox toolbar popping up when mouse is at top of screen in full-screen mode (without kiosk mode, please)? " is top hit in searches. The solution is no longer exact for Release 85.

The code snippet should be amended to remove the XUL namespace which now renders the CSS ineffective. Quite simply,

  1. fullscr-toggler { display:none !important; }

Is sufficient. See https://www.userchrome.org/adding-style-recipes-userchrome-css.html for guidance on using namespaces with customisations.

title: Firefox Japanese Fonts Messed Up
content:
I am using Firefox on Debian 10 (78.6.1esr) and my Japanese fonts got messed up after I installed a new font on the system. I installed the font into my Debian user folder, and it applied to everything as the default font. The fix was pretty easy, I simply removed it and everything want back to normal, except Firefox. Firefox for some reason is the only thing insistent on continuing to use the font, despite my font settings in Firefox set to use a more standard font. It wouldn't be so bad but the font in question doesn't have all the characters so the display is rather hideous in some cases. I tried to reset Firefox by renaming ~/.mozilla/firefox to ~/.mozilla/firefox.old, but the font remains. I've ran with it for about a month but I cannot take it anymore and have spent a days worth of hours trying to fix it.

I've attached on image showing the display, and another showing my font settings. about:config does not show the offending font.

Thanks!

title: firefox 85 download
content: Why are there Chrome .idb files in my Firefox 85 browser? I've never used Chrome browser and don't have Chrome installed. These idb files take up a large amount of space. Also when first downloaded 85 seemed pretty fast. Now, after a few days it is back to being pretty slow. Could this Chrome stuff be effecting my browser in an adverse way?
